p: As the climate movement is increasingly disillusioned by the inertia of our global fossil metabolism, some militant activists will advocate violent sabotage (cf. Malm 2021). While the frustration and despair are understandable, attacks against fossil infrastructure effective enough to cripple our dependence on fossil fuels are unlikely to be able to discriminate between the luxury consumption of the super‐rich and the subsistence needs of the economically least resilient. Such sabotage is thus morally incompatible with the struggle for climate justice. Nor is the call for eco‐sabotage likely to enhance the legitimacy of the climate movement.
